author: detroitnews.com
title: Entertainment Calendar
text:
Singer Chrisette Michele performs at the Music Hall Center with Eric Roberson on Friday. (Photo: Jason Kempin / Getty Images) 
CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE big shows 
THURSDAY 
Luna at Saint Andrew’s Hall, rock, 7 p.m. Thurs. $20. 431 E. Congress, Detroit. (313) 961-8961.
America’s Got Talent Live at Sound Board at MotorCity Casino Hotel, variety, 8 p.m. Thurs. $35-$50. 2901 Grand River, Detroit. (313) 309-4700.
FRIDAY

Chrisette Michele with Eric Roberson at Music Hall Center for the Performing Arts, R&B/pop, 8 p.m. Fri. $49.50-$79.50. 350 Madison, Detroit. (313) 833-8501.
Frank Marino’s Divas Live in Detroit at Sound Board at Sound Board at MotorCity Casino Hotel, drag show, 8 p.m. Fri. $27-$37. 2901 Grand River, Detroit. (313) 309-4700.
SOJA at Saint Andrew’s Hall, reggae, 8 p.m. Fri. $20. 431 E. Congress, Detroit. (313) 961-8961.
Adventure Club with Snails and Kayzo at Fillmore Detroit, electronic/dance, 8 p.m. Fri. $25-$35. 2115 Woodward, Detroit. (313) 961-5450.
Lewis Black at Dow Event Center, comedy, 8 p.m. Fri. $35-$45. 303 Johnson, Saginaw. (989) 759-1320.
Kill the Noise with Wuki at Elektricity, electronic, 9:30 p.m. Fri. $15. 15 S. Saginaw, Pontiac. (248) 599-2212.

Gordon Lightfoot at Caesars Windsor, pop/folk, 9 p.m. Sat. $22 Canadian and up. 377 Riverside Drive East, Windsor. (800) 991-7777.

live music

Theatre Nova presents “Bright Half Life” at Yellow Barn, 7:30 p.m. Thurs.-Sat. and 2 p.m. Sun. (through Oct. 25). $20 suggested donation. 416 W. Huron, Ann Arbor. (734) 635-8450.

Carlos Mencia at Mark Ridley’s Comedy Castle, 8 p.m. Thurs and 8 and 10:30 p.m. Fri.-Sat. $25-$30. 310 S. Troy, Royal Oak. (248) 542-9900.

“Dirty Dancing” at Fisher Theatre, 8 p.m. Tues. and Wed. (through Nov. 1). $39 and up. 3011 W. Grand Blvd., Detroit. (313) 872-1000.

“Pride Tailgate Comedy Show” with Jennie McNulty at Mark Ridley’s Comedy Castle, 8 p.m. Wed. $20. 310 S. Troy, Royal Oak. (248) 542-9900.
visual arts/film 
THIS WEEK 
Our Town Art Show and Sale at Community House, 10 a.m.-6 p.m. Thurs.-Sat. 380 South Bates, Birmingham. (248) 644-5832.
“The Birds” with appearance by Tippi Hedren at Redford Theatre, 8 p.m. Fri. and 1 p.m. Sun. $7. 17360 Lahser, Detroit. (313) 537-2560.
FRIDAY 
Works by Ash Nowak, Fatima Sow, Freddy Diaz, Laura Finlay, Marko Pavlovski, Mary Williams, Miles Rene, Ndubisi Okoye, Paul Johnson, Tony Rave and William Singer at Red Bull House of Art, 7-11 p.m. Fri. opening reception, open 10 a.m.-3 p.m. Saturdays. 1551 Winder, Detroit. (313) 758-9219 or redbullhouseofart.com.
SATURDAY 
HalloScreens film series with “Edward Scissorhands” at Campus Martius, 7:30 p.m. Sat. Free. 800 Woodward, Detroit. (313) 962-0101.
“Marnie” with appearance by Tippi Hedren at Redford Theatre, 8 p.m. Sat. $7. 17360 Lahser, Detroit. (313) 537-2560.
SUNDAY 
“30 Americans” exhibition, which explores racial, gender, political and historical identity in contemporary culture at Detroit Institute of Arts, opens 10 a.m. Sunday, runs through Jan. 18. Museum hours: 10 a.m.-5 p.m. Sat.-Sun., 9 a.m.-4 p.m. Tues.-Thurs. and 9 a.m.-10 p.m. Fri. $14. Free admission Sunday. 5200 Woodward, Detroit. (313) 833-7900.
etc. 
THIS WEEKEND 
Hallowe’en at Greenfield Village, 6:30-9 p.m. Thurs.-Sat. and 6:30-8 p.m. Sun. (also Oct. 22-25). $16, $13.75 for members. 20900 Oakwood, Dearborn. (313) 982-6001.
Zoo Boo trick-or-treat trail at Detroit Zoo, 5-8 p.m. Fri.-Sun. (also Oct. 23-25). $8. Free for babies younger than two. 8450 W. 10 Mile, Royal Oak. (248) 541-5717.
Halloween Science at Cranbrook Institute of Science, 6:30 p.m. Fri. and 11 a.m. and 3:30 p.m. Sat. $17 per child, $5 per adult, discount for members. 39221 Woodward, Bloomfield Hills. (248) 645-3200.
Ann Arbor Antiques Market, 8 a.m.-4 p.m. Sat. and 10 a.m.-4 p.m. Sun. $6. 5055 Ann Arbor-Saline Road, Ann Arbor. (734) 678-0173.
FRIDAY 
Fall Festival and Chili Cook-Off in downtown Wyandotte, 5-10 p.m. Fri. Downtown Wyandotte. wyandottebiz.org.
SUNDAY 
Nitro Circus Live freestyle motocross at Joe Louis Arena, 6 p.m. Sun. $42-$102. 19 Steve Yzerman Drive, Detroit. (313) 396-7000.
MONDAY 
Metro Detroit Book & Author Society fall book luncheon with Bonnie Jo Campbell, Jason Gay, John Katzenbach, Lily Tuck and David Maraniss at Burton Manor, 11 a.m. Mon. $40. 27777 Schoolcraft, Livonia. (586) 685-5750.

our picks 
THEATRE BIZARRE 
at Masonic Temple 
One of the grandest Halloween parties the area has to offer, this yearly bash includes rock bands, live performances, comedy, circus acts, burlesque and more. Some of the 20 bands to play include Black Jake & the Carnies, Koffin Kats, the Ruiners and the Beggars. Costumes — good ones — are considered mandatory. If you have a ticket, consider yourself lucky because this event has sold out. 6:30 p.m. Sat. 500 Temple, Detroit. theatrebizarre.com.
‘BACK TO THE FUTURE 2’ 
at Redford Theatre 
We knew this day would come, but we didn’t think it would be so soon. Oct. 21, 2015 — which is next Wednesday — is the date on which Marty McFly traveled into the future in the 1989 film “Back to the Future 2.” Redford Theatre will show the film, which stars Michael J. Fox, Christopher Lloyd, Tom Wilson and Lea Thompson. See how the real future holds up to Hollywood’s 1989 version. 8 p.m. Wed. $5. 17360 Lahser, Detroit. (313) 537-2560.
